newsitem.title: UK: Heavy rains seen abating in southern Peru.
newsitem.headline: Heavy rains seen abating in southern Peru.

text.p: No more heavy rain is forecast over the next few weeks in southern Peru, where flooding caused copper output to be disrupted at operations of Asarco Inc's Southern Peru Copper Corp, U.S.-based private forecaster Weather Services Corp (WSC) said on Wednesday.
Asarco said on Tuesday operations had been curtailed since Monday at the Toquepala and Cuajone mines and a smelter at Ilo in southern Peru after being hit by flooding and heavy rains.
"Heavy rain is not likely as the region returns to a more normal weather pattern," senior meteorologist Joel Burgio told Reuters by telephone.
The strong front that pounded the area recently was unusual for the time of year, he added.
"Currently the area is under sunny to partly cloudy skies," he said, adding that there was a chance of light to locally moderate showers over the next few weeks.
